problem_name: Real-time Peak Segmentation in X-ray Crystallography
description: Real-time peak segmentation involves identifying and analyzing peaks in X-ray diffraction data to determine the structure of crystalline materials. This process is crucial for researchers in materials science and chemistry, as it allows for the rapid analysis of large datasets generated by X-ray experiments.
you_have_this_if: You are working with large datasets from X-ray diffraction experiments.
You need to identify peaks in real-time during data acquisition.
You want to minimize manual intervention in peak detection.
You require a solution that can be deployed in edge computing environments.
You are facing challenges with traditional peak detection methods.

approaches.best_for: When you need to process large volumes of X-ray diffraction data in real-time and automate peak detection.
approaches.key_tradeoff: While PeakNet offers automation and scalability, it may require significant initial setup and training data.

decision_matrix.best_when: You need a scalable and automated solution for real-time peak detection in X-ray crystallography.

start_here: Start with PeakNet for its ability to handle large datasets and automate peak detection, making it suitable for real-time applications.
